Description: Body fragment of red slipped pottery open vessel (shallow dish?). Red-brown slip inside and out. Fine yellow clay fabric with few white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Prins de Jong suggests the fabric is that of the lagynos, her X.1.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 69, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.130)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: X.2 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
